text:
I was a shy and introverted child growing up. I was never one to make friends easily, and often kept to myself, spending much of my time in my room alone. I had a vivid imagination and loved to play with ideas and come up with new stories and inventions. I had a strong personality, but was often overlooked or ignored by other kids.

My home life wasn't always great either. I was often anxious and worried about things, and I was scared of taking risks. I had a hard time trusting people and was often cold and distant with others. My parents were both hard-working, but they were often too busy to pay much attention to me, so I often felt like I was alone in the world.

I was conscientious and worked hard at school, but I was also easily distracted and had trouble paying attention. I was creative, but I wasn't very organized and often had trouble finishing tasks I started. I was a good student, but my grades weren't always the best.

I loved to read and to learn new things, and I was often curious about different topics and ideas. I was often sad and depressed, but I found comfort in my books and in my own thoughts.

I was a dreamer, and I often imagined what it would be like to be someone else living a different life. I was closed to experience, but I often yearned to explore the world and experience new things.

I was neurotic and often got nervous easily. I was often tense and not always easy going. I had trouble forgiving others and often started arguments with them. I was often moody and had trouble staying calm in difficult situations.

My childhood was full of ups and downs, but I am thankful for the experiences I had and what I learned from them. I may be introverted, antagonistic, unconscientious, neurotic, and closed to experience, but I am also creative and inventive, clever, kind, and considerate. I may not always trust people, but I am still capable of loving and caring for them.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
